serveR.title: ServeR — Backendless Test Environment for Frontend
serveR.summary_desc: ServeR is a *mock/virtual backend* solution I designed for **frontend teams** to maintain development and **test automation** even if the real backend isn't ready.
serveR.problem_desc: UI development in distributed teams slows down until API contracts are completed. ServeR was developed with the goal of *minimizing waiting* by supporting a **contract-first** approach.
design_features: Scenario-based response generation (success, empty data, error, delay, etc.).
Mock generation from **schema/contract** for REST and GraphQL.
Fast switching and reset with CLI & lightweight management layer.
Portable installation with Docker image and **CI/CD** pipeline.
role_features: Design and development of the core **scenario engine**.
Socket.IO based real-time event publish/subscribe infrastructure.
Setting up **fixture/seed** flows suitable for test automation.
results_features: UI development process became **less dependent** on the real backend.
Edge-case scenarios and connection issues became **visible early**.
Practical experience gained in real-time systems, test culture, and **corporate code standards**.

tiki.title: Tiki Taka Toe — 3x3 Strategy with Football Knowledge
tiki.summary_desc: **Tiki Taka Toe** is a multiplayer mobile game that combines football knowledge and strategy. *National teams* and *clubs* are listed on the edges of a 4x4 board; football players who meet both criteria are written in the 3x3 intersection areas in the center.
mechanics_list: Edged of the board: national team and club names in the top/left headers.
Center 3x3 cell: a football player who meets both criteria in the relevant row and column is entered.
When the move is verified, the cell is locked with the **X** or **O** mark of the player who made the move.
Winning: forming a vertical/horizontal/diagonal triple; accuracy of information takes priority in a draw.
architecture_list: **Flutter (Dart)** client: board state, turn management, and verification feedback.
**Python-based backend**: player–club–national team matching verification engine.
**WebSocket** lobby: room creation/joining, real-time matching, and turn updates.
Game rules are stored on the server side; invalid moves are immediately rejected.
role_list: Implementation of the Flutter interface and game loop (turn, validity, end).
Development of the Python verification service and WebSocket-based **lobby/room** architecture.
Management of real-time synchronization and error/edge cases in the competition flow.
learnings_list: **Consistency** and **latency tolerance** in real-time room structures and turn management.
**Flexible schema** for info verification rules and UX against network delays.
Maintaining game flow by simplifying error scenarios in mobile-server communication.
